channel.title: ASF JIRA
channel.description: This file is an XML representation of an issue

item.title: [HADOOP-16385] Namenode crashes with "RedundancyMonitor thread received Runtime exception"
item.description:
*Description: *While removing dead nodes, Namenode went down with error "RedundancyMonitor thread received Runtime exception"

*Environment: *
Server OS :- UBUNTU
No. of Cluster Node:- 1NN / 225DN's / 3ZK / 2RM/ 4850 NMs
total 240 machines, in each machine 21 docker containers (1 DN & 20 NM's)

Steps:
1. Total number of containers running state : ~53000
2. Because of the load, machine was going to outofMemory and restarting the machine and starting all the docker containers including NM's and DN's
3. in some point namenode throughs below error while removing a node and NN went down.

2019-06-19 05:54:07,262 INFO org.apache.hadoop.net.NetworkTopology: Removing a node: /rack-1550/255.255.117.195:23735
2019-06-19 05:54:07,263 INFO org.apache.hadoop.hdfs.StateChange: BLOCK* removeDeadDatanode: lost heartbeat from 255.255.117.151:23735, removeBlocksFromBlockMap true
2019-06-19 05:54:07,281 INFO org.apache.hadoop.net.NetworkTopology: Removing a node: /rack-4097/255.255.117.151:23735
2019-06-19 05:54:07,282 INFO org.apache.hadoop.hdfs.StateChange: BLOCK* removeDeadDatanode: lost heartbeat from 255.255.116.213:23735, removeBlocksFromBlockMap true
2019-06-19 05:54:07,290 ERROR org.apache.hadoop.hdfs.server.blockmanagement.BlockManager: RedundancyMonitor thread received Runtime exception.
java.lang.IllegalArgumentException: 247 should >= 248, and both should be positive.
        at com.google.common.base.Preconditions.checkArgument(Preconditions.java:88)
        at org.apache.hadoop.net.NetworkTopology.chooseRandom(NetworkTopology.java:575)
        at org.apache.hadoop.net.NetworkTopology.chooseRandom(NetworkTopology.java:552)
        at org.apache.hadoop.hdfs.net.DFSNetworkTopology.chooseRandomWithStorageTypeTwoTrial(DFSNetworkTopology.java:122)
        at org.apache.hadoop.hdfs.server.blockmanagement.BlockPlacementPolicyDefault.chooseDataNode(BlockPlacementPolicyDefault.java:873)
        at org.apache.hadoop.hdfs.server.blockmanagement.BlockPlacementPolicyDefault.chooseRandom(BlockPlacementPolicyDefault.java:770)
        at org.apache.hadoop.hdfs.server.blockmanagement.BlockPlacementPolicyDefault.chooseRemoteRack(BlockPlacementPolicyDefault.java:712)
        at org.apache.hadoop.hdfs.server.blockmanagement.BlockPlacementPolicyDefault.chooseTargetInOrder(BlockPlacementPolicyDefault.java:507)
        at org.apache.hadoop.hdfs.server.blockmanagement.BlockPlacementPolicyDefault.chooseTarget(BlockPlacementPolicyDefault.java:425)
        at org.apache.hadoop.hdfs.server.blockmanagement.BlockPlacementPolicyDefault.chooseTargets(BlockPlacementPolicyDefault.java:311)
        at org.apache.hadoop.hdfs.server.blockmanagement.BlockPlacementPolicyDefault.chooseTarget(BlockPlacementPolicyDefault.java:290)
        at org.apache.hadoop.hdfs.server.blockmanagement.BlockPlacementPolicyDefault.chooseTarget(BlockPlacementPolicyDefault.java:143)
        at org.apache.hadoop.hdfs.server.blockmanagement.BlockPlacementPolicy.chooseTarget(BlockPlacementPolicy.java:103)
        at org.apache.hadoop.hdfs.server.blockmanagement.ReplicationWork.chooseTargets(ReplicationWork.java:51)
        at org.apache.hadoop.hdfs.server.blockmanagement.BlockManager.computeReconstructionWorkForBlocks(BlockManager.java:1902)
        at org.apache.hadoop.hdfs.server.blockmanagement.BlockManager.computeBlockReconstructionWork(BlockManager.java:1854)
        at org.apache.hadoop.hdfs.server.blockmanagement.BlockManager.computeDatanodeWork(BlockManager.java:4842)
        at org.apache.hadoop.hdfs.server.blockmanagement.BlockManager$RedundancyMonitor.run(BlockManager.java:4709)
        at java.lang.Thread.run(Thread.java:748)
2019-06-19 05:54:07,296 INFO org.apache.hadoop.util.ExitUtil: Exiting with status 1: java.lang.IllegalArgumentException: 247 should >= 248, and both should be positive.
2019-06-19 05:54:07,298 INFO org.apache.hadoop.hdfs.server.common.HadoopAuditLogger.audit: process=Namenode     operation=shutdown      result=invoked
2019-06-19 05:54:07,298 INFO org.apache.hadoop.hdfs.server.namenode.NameNode: SHUTDOWN_MSG:
/************************************************************
SHUTDOWN_MSG: Shutting down NameNode at namenode/255.255.182.104
************************************************************/
item.summary: Namenode crashes with "RedundancyMonitor thread received Runtime exception"

status.description: A resolution has been taken, and it is awaiting verification by reporter. From here issues are either reopened, or are closed.

comments.comment: mkris.reddy@gmail.com, Thanks for your report, this is interesting issue, would like to offer which hadoop version do you deploy?
Hadoop version is 3.1.1

Preconditions.checkArgument(
        totalInScopeNodes >= availableNodes && availableNodes > 0, String
            .format("%d should >= %d, and both should be positive.",
                totalInScopeNodes, availableNodes));

This condition throws IllegalArgumentException due to race condition b/w calculation of availableNodes and totalInScopeNodes, Since the cluster was having too many restarts, this seems to have occur,

Prior to HADOOP-15317 there was only a single check if availableNodes > 0 (That is still present before this check L548) that seems fair enough and if that was voilated no exception we return NULL , if there is a single available node, we should be able to select it.

if the condition is voilated too as in this case, this shouldn't affect selection process. Moreover a RuntimeException shouldn't be thrown from BPP to NN in general.

IMO this Condition can be removed and the availableNodes> 0 already present can be relied upon.

Thanks ayushtkn for your digs. I think it's better to involve xiaochen to take a look.
I am also confused how this condition totalInScopeNodes < availableNodes appear?

I found the following code will run unexpected, and I will resolve it later. cc ayushtkn
NetworkTopology#chooseRandom(final String scope, String excludedScope, final Collection<Node> excludedNodes) line 532-537:

    if (excludedScope == null) {
      availableNodes = countNumOfAvailableNodes(scope, excludedNodes);
    } else {
      availableNodes =
          countNumOfAvailableNodes("~" + excludedScope, excludedNodes);
    }
Are you pointing to something fixed in HADOOP-16028

Are you pointing to something fixed in HADOOP-16028

correct, I believe HADOOP-16028 could resolve this issue completely and just verify and it works well. I will move this JIRA to common project and backport HADOOP-16028 to branch-3.1. FYI.
Just backport HADOOP-16028 to branch-3.1 and pending Jenkins. cc ayushtkn could you help to take another reviews?

HADOOP-16028 can be directly cherry-picked to 3.1, Doesn't require a separate patch. I will ping up there.
The 3.1.1 mentioned is our internal one, We have this HADOOP-16028 in. Will check once again tomorrow too.
So, if so this shouldn't be the issue.

HADOOP-16028 can be directly cherry-picked to 3.1, Doesn't require a separate patch. I will ping up there.

All right, it make sense. Thanks.

+1 overall

Cherry-picked HADOOP-16028 to branch-3.1 and branch-3.2.
I hope this fixes the issue.

The semantics of NetworkTopology#chooseRandom(final String scope, String excludedScope, final Collection<Node> excludedNodes)  are not rigorous. 

But in the production, scope and excludedScope may be only like this:

  1. scope is NodeBase.ROOT and excludedScope is not null.
  2. scope is some topology and excludedScope is null.

And Scope is '/a1/b1' and excludedScope is '/a1/b1/c1' may be not exist like TestCode.

 

As above, the result of chooseRandom may be is OK in Production.

I think the error stack may be have some other reasons.

 

hexiaoqiao  can you reconfirm that?
Thanks xuzq_zander for your deep dig. I think HADOOP-16028 may could solve your doubt. Anyway welcome some more discussion. Thanks xuzq_zander again.

We  had 16028, with us and still it happened, Tried checking up, there is just evidences of constant restarts of datanodes.

Out of conclusion here we reached, At any cause, a write shouldn't crash the namenode, the worst case if the DN can't be found the dn returned should be null, and write should fail rather than crashing the namenode.

The only check that makes sense it to check if there is any available node, if so we should return it,

Which was already present :

    if (availableNodes > 0) {
      ret = chooseRandom(innerNode, node, excludedNodes, numOfDatanodes,
          availableNodes);
    }

This too here doesn't throw a RuntimeException, Just a null as the choosen datanode.

Couldn't find any hard reasons from HADOOP-15317 which justifies this.

So, Uploading v1 removing the check!!!
Maybe not a crash but I would still return something early or at least log it.

Thanx elgoiri

Does adding something like this make sense :

    if (totalInScopeNodes < availableNodes) {
      totalInScopeNodes = availableNodes;
      LOG.debug("Total Nodes in scope : {} are less than Available Nodes : {}",
          totalInScopeNodes, availableNodes);
    }

The write shall also not fail too, Since there are available nodes it will select from them.

-1 overall

Changing totalInScopeNodes = availableNodes; is a little more than what we had to.
Can we have a unit test for this test at least?

totalInScopeNodes is used for getting a random number, so as to decide which Dn to hit, I changed it since, if such a scenario happens, if the random number chosen is equal or less than available nodes a DN will be returned otherwise null, I changed it to ensure a DN is returned. (Let me know, if any concerns about it, Shall take it back)

Guess can't cover this by UT because sadly we don't know how this happened and this neither seems to be a very rare happening.

We just removed the check as it was throwing a RuntimeException and to our conclusion whenever this condition will become true the NN shall crash. That is why we decided to chunk it off.

What about just returning null and don't let it return a node?
We prevent the RuntimeException and we increase the chances for catching this.
I would evne throw an exception but that might be too much.

Changed to null as suggested,

Pls Review!!!

-1 overall

Yes, it looks like the usual suspects.
Committing to the branches.

FAILURE: Integrated in Jenkins build Hadoop-trunk-Commit #16852 (See https://builds.apache.org/job/Hadoop-trunk-Commit/16852/)
HADOOP-16385. Namenode crashes with 'RedundancyMonitor thread received (inigoiri: rev aa9f0850e85203b2ce4f4a8dc8968e9186cdc67a)

  • (edit) hadoop-common-project/hadoop-common/src/main/java/org/apache/hadoop/net/NetworkTopology.java

Thanks ayushtkn for working on this.
Committed to trunk, branch-3.2, and branch-3.1.

Thanks elgoiri,ayushtkn for your work.
+1 for remove `Preconditions.checkArgument` and avoid to crash namenode.
I am confused why this situation happened. After apply HADOOP-16028, totalInScopeNodes always greater than or equal to availableNodes based on the scope. Please correct me if something I missed.

    Preconditions.checkArgument(
        totalInScopeNodes >= availableNodes && availableNodes > 0, String
            .format("%d should >= %d, and both should be positive.",
                totalInScopeNodes, availableNodes));
Keep in mind that HADOOP-16028 is pretty new, so this happened before this.
Nevertheless I would even dedicate some more time and check, if I can get some conclusive evidence.
